text: Ahmed Haitham (; born 17 September 1980) is a Maldivian politician and a former parliamentarian, known for his advocacy in social justice, child welfare, and anti-corruption efforts. He is a former member of the People's Majlis representing South Machangoalhi constituency. He was elected in 2019, serving until 2024. In 2023, amidst internal party discord, he resigned from the Maldivian Democratic Party (MDP) and subsequently aligned himself with the People's National Congress. Haitham was known for his active role in social justice, child welfare, and health-related issues during his tenure. He is credited with orchestrating a Maldivian ban on Israeli passports as well as unveiling high-profile corruption in COVID-19 ventilator procurement, culminating in the ousting of the health minister in 2021. On 17 December 2023, during his tenure as a parliamentarian, Ahmed Haitham was elected to the executive committee of the Global Organization of Parliamentarians Against Corruption (GOPAC), serving as the Country Treasurer. == Personal life == On 15 October 2020, Haitham got married to Shajaan Muaz Shaheem. Shajaan gave birth to their twins, a girl and a boy, in august of 2021, prematurely at 29 weeks due to threats and harassment during her pregnancy. Together, they have three more children. == References == Category:Environmentalists Category:1980 births Category:Living people
title: Ahmed Haitham
